text: Mueller finishes with no new indictments, and feeling in Trump world is pretty optimistic tonight. “The fact that there are no more indictments is a big deal,” @David_Bossie told me, adding a big cloud over president is ending. But details still to come.

text: Trump did not mention Mueller at dinner tonight in Palm Beach, per attendee. Spoke briefly — less than 3 minutes, per attendee.

text: Mueller sends report to DOJ, ending a major chapter in the Trump presidency, with no new indictments forthcoming. But lots more to come. text: Giuliani says that he has no knowledge of the contents of the report & only learned that it was being transmitted earlier this hour from an official on the Hill. He says that Trump lawyers want to see report before it becomes public but he has gotten no firm assurance they will.

text: Bolton praised new North Korea sanctions -- now reversed by Trump on Twitter -- as an important tool. In Hanoi, Trump knew Bolton took a dim view of Kim Jong Un -- and POTUS kept him away from close interactions, such as a private dinner. He wants a deal.
author: jdawsey1

text:
Trump takes an extraordinary step of reversing his own government on North Korean sanctions, as he fixates on still striking a deal with Kim Jong Un and tells others that his advisers have too dim a view of the brutal dictator. w/@John_Hudson:

text: Trump often draws wide outrage when he attacks a late senator, calls media the “enemy of the people,” accuses a predecessor of spying on him or wildly misstates a fact, etc. Then he often does the same thing that drew outrage at first over and over, and it gets more of a shrug.
author: jdawsey1

text: Trump attacks McCain again, says he didn't get 'thank you' for approving funeral. The five-minute long unprompted attack at an economic speech in Ohio came after months of stewing about the late senator and GOP colleagues begging him to let it go. https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2019/03/20/mccain-family-deserves-better-republican-senator-says-trump-continues-lash-out/ …

text: Several current and former aides described Trump’s weekend Twitter episode as borne out of idle hands. Limited staff around, few obligations, no golf, 48 hours looking at the walls... “it never works out well,” one former senior aide said. Averaged more than a tweet an hour.

text: FAA officials defended Boeing aggressively for some time after second plane fell, telling the president there was no reason to ground the planes. Available data for review was delayed. Eventually, Trump announced the grounding himself in an unusual move.
author: jdawsey1

text: The FAA pushed to protect Boeing, even after its planes fell from the sky. Its lobbyists worked the administration hard. The president grew heavily & unusually involved in the decision -- eventually announcing it even after he said he wouldn't. Our latest: https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/trafficandcommuting/trump-cast-himself-as-boeings-decider-in-chief-showing-the-perils-of-injecting-politics-into-investigations/2019/03/17/f79aeb84-472f-11e9-8aab-95b8d80a1e4f_story.html?utm_term=.db5dfb80b100 …
